Module com.example.sudokuproject
Package com.example.sudokuproject.controller

Class SudokuGameController

java.lang.Object
com.example.sudokuproject.controller.SudokuGameController
public class SudokuGameController extends Object
SudokuGameController is responsible for managing the logic and user interactions in the Sudoku game. It handles the rendering of the Sudoku board, user input, and validations of the Sudoku grid cells. The controller uses animations to visually indicate invalid inputs, as well as help the user by suggesting valid numbers for empty cells.
Author:
Mateo Noguera Pinto

  • Constructor Details

    • SudokuGameController

      public SudokuGameController()
      Default constructor initializes the SudokuGameModel.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the Sudoku grid and sets event listeners for handling user input when typing or releasing keys within the text fields.

    • renderBoard

      public void renderBoard()
      Renders the Sudoku board in the graphical user interface (GUI). It retrieves the current state of the board from the model and updates the gridMatrix with the corresponding numbers. If a cell is empty (value 0), it sets the text field to be empty and editable. Otherwise, it displays the number and makes the cell non-editable.

    • orderGrid

      public void orderGrid()
      Orders the grid in the GUI by mapping each TextField in the sudokuGrid to its respective position in the gridMatrix. This method retrieves the row and column indices of each text field and stores them in the corresponding position in the gridMatrix for future reference.

    • onHelpPressed

      public void onHelpPressed()
      Handles the event when the help button is pressed. This method finds an empty cell and provides a valid suggestion to the user. If no suggestion can be found, it displays a message and an animation.

    • existsWinner

      public boolean existsWinner()
      Checks if the current state of the Sudoku board represents a winning configuration. It retrieves the current numbers entered by the player in the grid, converts the text from the gridMatrix to an integer array representing the board, and checks if this configuration meets the winning criteria using the model's existsWinner() method.
      Returns:
      true if the current board configuration is a valid solution (i.e., a win), false otherwise.

    • handleKeyTyped

      public void handleKeyTyped(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
      Handles the KeyEvent when a key is typed inside a text field. It validates the input and ensures that only one number is entered per cell.
      Parameters:
      event - The KeyEvent triggered by typing inside the cell.

    • handleKeyReleased

      public void handleKeyReleased(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
      Handles the KeyEvent when a key is released inside a text field. It removes the "wrongCell" CSS class if the field is empty and stops any running animations.
      Parameters:
      event - The KeyEvent triggered by releasing a key inside the cell.

    • getNumbersInColumn

      public ArrayList<Integer> getNumbersInColumn(int col)
      Retrieves all numbers present in the specified column.
      Parameters:
      col - The index of the column.
      Returns:
      A list of integers representing the numbers in the column.

    • getNumbersInRow

      public ArrayList<Integer> getNumbersInRow(int row)
      Retrieves all numbers present in the specified row.
      Parameters:
      row - The index of the row.
      Returns:
      A list of integers representing the numbers in the row.

    • isValidNumber

      public boolean isValidNumber(int digit, javafx.util.Pair<Integer,Integer> cell)
      Validates if the specified number can be placed in the given cell. The method checks the numbers in the same row, column, and 2x3 block.
      Parameters:
      digit - The number to be validated.
      cell - The cell where the number is being placed, represented by a pair of column and row indices.
      Returns:
      True if the number is valid, false otherwise.

    • getBlockNumbers

      public ArrayList<Integer> getBlockNumbers(int fromCol, int fromRow)
      Retrieves all numbers present in the 2x3 block of cells.
      Parameters:
      fromCol - The starting column index of the block.
      fromRow - The starting row index of the block.
      Returns:
      A list of integers representing the numbers in the block.

    • getEmptyCells

      public ArrayList<TextFieldInfo> getEmptyCells()
      Retrieves all empty cells in the Sudoku grid.
      Returns:
      A list of TextFieldInfo objects representing the empty cells.

    • startWrongCellTransition

      public void startWrongCellTransition(javafx.scene.control.TextField textField)
      Starts a fade transition on a text field, visually indicating that it contains an invalid value. The transition makes the text field blink until corrected.
      Parameters:
      textField - The text field that contains an invalid value.

    • stopWrongCellTransition

      public void stopWrongCellTransition(javafx.scene.control.TextField textField)
      Stops the fade transition for the specified text field, removing any visual indication that it contains an invalid value.
      Parameters:
      textField - The text field that no longer contains an invalid value.

    • LabelFadeTransition

      public void LabelFadeTransition(javafx.scene.control.Label label)
      Applies a fade transition to the specified label, gradually reducing its opacity.
      Parameters:
      label - The label to which the fade transition is applied.
